results.title: Cary Grant: the leading man
results.creator_credit: Wombat Productions, Inc., Gene Feldman and Suzette Winter
results.brief_description: Born Alexander Archibald Leech in Bristol, England 1904, the son of working class parents. Always interested in acting and the theatre, Cary rose to fame after being discovered by Mae West. Her confidence in the young man she befriended paid off when Cary overcame his humble beginnings to become a favourite Hollywood icon, whose resume of films include ‘Bringing Up Baby’, ‘An Affair to Remember’, ‘His Girl Friday’ and ‘North by Northwest’. This documentary highlights the highs and lows of his career and uses family photos, archival footage and clips from his films to show the many faces of one of Hollywood’s most admired male actors. Includes interviews with friends and colleagues including: Leslie Caron; Douglas Fairbanks Jr; Deborah Kerr; Eva Marie Saint; Ralph Bellamy; Stanley Donen; Richard Brooks and Stanley Kramer.

results.title: Carving Techniques and Projects
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the basics of gouge and chisel work, discussing the choice of tools, ideas and how to adjust designs. Shows how to carve the hallmark of 18th century furniture: the classic scallop shell.

results.title: Carved in ivory
results.creator_credit: Concord Films, Arts Council of Great Britain and Michael Gill
results.brief_description: Examines small ivory sculptures created by anonymous masters from 700-1200 A.D. Much of their work decorates devotional objects such as croziers, crosses and caskets and their themes are mainly religious. Includes carvings from collections in Brunswick, Brussels, Copenhagen, Munich, Paris and New York besides a number from the Victoria and Albert and other museums in Britain. Describes these art objects in their historical and artistic context. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.

results.title: Carve her name with pride [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Society for Education in Film and Television, Daniel M. Angel and Lewis Gilbert
results.brief_description: An extract from “Carve her name with pride”. Tells the story of Violette Szabo, the British secret agent, who undertook various missions in Occupied France during the Second World War, until she was captured and finally shot in Germany. Cast: Violette Szabo - Virginia McKenna Jacques - Maurice Ronet Interrogator - Noel Willman

results.title: Carve her name with pride
results.creator_credit: Daniel M. Angel, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Muir Mathieson
results.brief_description: Based on R.J. Minney’s novel this inspiring true story of war heroine, Violette Szabo, who volunteered to be parachuted into France as a secret agent to re-organise a shattered resistance group. Virginia McKenna gives the performance of her career as the courageous secret agent, and this magnificent film ensures that no-one will forget Violette’s bravery and conviction in what she believed in most - freedom from tyranny. Also stars Paul Scofield, Jack Warner, Denise Grey and Maurice Ronet.

results.title: Carve a Ball and Claw Foot
results.brief_description: Learn how to scale the ball-and-claw to furniture plan, how to machine stock to yield a graceful bandsaw cabriole leg ready for carving, how to lay out form, cut-in with a mallet and gouge and shape the dragon’s claw for a vigorous looking grip, how to carve efficiently, keeping tools sharp as you work.
results.description: Learn how to scale the ball-and-claw to furniture plan, how to machine stock to yield a graceful bandsaw cabriole leg ready for carving, how to lay out form, cut-in with a mallet and gouge and shape the dragon’s claw for a vigorous looking grip, how to carve efficiently, keeping tools sharp as you work.

results.title: Cartouche = Swords of Blood
results.creator_credit: Georges Dancigers, Ariane, Filmsonor, VIDES Cinematografica and Philippe De Broca
results.brief_description: Jean-Paul Belmondo is a good-hearted thief operating in 18th century Paris. He teams up with Venus, a gipsy pickpocket (Claudia Cardinale), overthrows the leader of the pickpocket gang (Marcel Dalio) and turns it into a crime syndicate that gives the fancy baubles of the rich to the poor. “Cartouche” encompasses tragedy, farce and violence in a popular, high-flown adventure.

results.title: Cartoon classics of the 30's
results.brief_description: A historic collection of classic animated cartoons from the 1930s including two very famous and much loved characters, Felix the Cat (The Goose that laid the golden egg) and Daffy Duck. Entertaining family viewing but also a fascinating look back at animation styles and techniques of the era. NB: Quality of sound and color is variable.

results.title: Carthage rediscovered
results.brief_description: Carthage was once a maritime city open to the whole of the ancient world, today it is a suburb of Tunis but one has only to dig beneath the asphalt of any part of modern Carthage, to find extensive remains of the ancient city. Several missions are today making excavations in various areas in the hope of saving the stones and the mosaics.

results.title: Carter's new world
results.creator_credit: Austin Hoyt, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, WGBH (Boston) and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Nuclear age”.
Jimmy Carter began his presidency with a vision of a new world of non-nuclear peace, but his dream was shattered by constant domestic and international pressures. In 1977, when he took office, Carter pledged to reduce miltary spending, pursue a foreign policy based on human rights and to negotiate arms control with the Soviet Union. By 1981, he had ordered the Senate to halt the ratification of the SALT II Treaty and the deployment of MX and Cruise Missiles. This program examines the failure of Carter’s vision and includes frank interviews with the former President, his Secretary of State, Cyrus Vance, and Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei Gromyko.
